children.name: the internet and places on the internet
the internet a1
children.definition: (the) internet/(the) net/(ði) ˈɪntəʳnet, (ðə) ˈnet/  a network of computer connections that allows computer users around the world to exchange information:
examples: hệ thống thông tin toàn cầu
▪ the internet makes it possible for people all over the world to keep in touch.
▪ in theory, the net should make things quicker, but that isn’t always the case.
on the internet/net
▪ she spends nearly all her free time on the internet.
▪ the couple met on the internet.internet/net access
▪ the city’s libraries provide free internet access.
the internet,alsothe internetnoun[ s ] (informalthe net)
the large system of connected computers around the world which allows people to share information and communicate with each other using email
_i found out about the bombingsfrom/onthe internet.

children.name: e- x
children.definition: e-alsoe-/iː/  used to form words that relate to activities involving use of the internet, especially those connected with business.:
examples: thuộc về internet (kinh doanh, doanh nghiệp)
▪ e-commerce was then seen as a booming economic area.
e-prefix
abbreviation forelectronic
_e-commerce
_email
e-businessnoun[ c or u ]
the business of buying and selling goods and services
on the internet, or a particular company which does this
e-cashnoun[ u ]
money from a special bank account which is used to buy goods and
services over the internet by sending information from your computer
e-commercenoun[ u ]
the business of buying and selling goods and services on the internet
electronic bankingnoun[ u ] (alsoe-banking)
when customers use the internet to organize,examine and make changes to their bank accounts andinvestments, etc. electronically, or when banks operate accounts and services inthis way
_electronic bankingservices

children.name: cyber- x
children.definition: cyber-/ˈsaɪbəʳ/  used to form words that relate to activities involving the use of computers, especially the internet:
examples: thuộc về internet, mạng
▪ cyber-crime, for example the fraudulent use of credit cards on the net, presents particular problems for the police.
▪ he seems to spend all his time in cyberspace!
cyber-prefix
involving, using or relating to computers, especially the internet
_cybercrime
_cyberculture

children.name: dotcom x
children.definition: dotcom/ˈdɒtkɒmǁˈdɑːtkɑːm/  relating to a company whose business involves the internet:
examples: thuộc về mạng (công ty kinh doanh liên quan mạng)
▪ the business world was shaken by the huge drop in dotcom shares.
▪ dotcom jobs
dotcom[countable noun]
dot.com,dotcomnoun[ c ]
a company that does most of its business on the internet
_a survey found that 20 of the top 150 european dot.coms could run out of cash within a year.

children.name: website a1
children.definition: web site/ˈweb saɪt/  a place on the internet where you can find information about a particular company, organization, or person: trang mạng, đỉa chỉ trang web
examples: ▪ visit our website on www.stellamaryuk.
website,alsoweb sitenoun[ c ] (alsosite)
a set of pages of information on the internet about a particular subject, which have been published by the same person or organization, and often contain colour pictures, video and sound
_for more information about othercambridgepublications,visitour websiteatwww.cambridge.org.
sitea2noun[ c ]internet
a website

children.name: web page a2
children.definition: web page/ˈweb peɪdʒ/  one of the areas you can go to on a website: trang mạng, trang web
examples: ▪ do you want me to print off this web page?
pagenoun[ c ]computer
(alsoweb page) one part of a website
web page,alsowebpagenoun[ c ] (alsopage)
a page of information on the internet about a particular subject, that forms (a part of) a website
_a website may have many different web pages for you to click on and explore.

children.name: home page x
children.definition: home page/ˈhəʊm peɪdʒ/  the first place you go to on a website:
examples: trang chủ
▪ you can reach all the other pages on a website from its home page.
home pagenoun[c usually sing ]
the first page of a website which gives an introduction to the business or organization itbelongs to and links to more detailed information on other pages
home pagenoun[ c usually sing ]
aweb pageof your own choice that appears on your computer screen when you first connect to the internet
_to make this your home page, click here.

children.name: chat room x
children.definition: chat room/ˈtʃæt ruːm/  an area on the internet where people can talk to each other by sending messages that can be read or heard immediately:
examples: phòng hội thoại, khung trò chuyện
▪ children should be taught to be careful about who they talk to in chat rooms.
chat roomnoun[ c ] phòng tròchuyện
a part of the internet where you can use email to discuss a subject with other people

children.name: link b1/hyperlink x
children.definition: link/hyperlink /lɪŋk, ˈhaɪpəʳˌlɪŋk/  writing or pictures on a web page which you can click on if you want to immediately go to another website or to another web page on the same website: liên kết mạng
examples: ▪ for more info, click on this link.
linknoun[ c ]connection
a connection between documents on the internet
_click on this link to visit our online bookstore.
hyperlinknoun[ c ]
a connection that allows you to move easily between two computer documents or two pages on the internet

children.name: search engine x
children.definition: search engine/ˈsɜːʳtʃ ˌendʒn/  a computer program that helps you find information on the internet: công cụ tìm kiếm
examples: ▪ this search engine will only find sites that originate in europe.
search enginenoun[ c ]công cụ tìm kiếm; cỗ máy tìm kiếm
a computer program which finds information on the internet by looking for words which you have typed in

children.name: browser b2
children.definition: browser/ˈbraʊzəʳ/  a program, such as internet explorer or netscape navigator, that allows you to find and read documents on the internet:
examples: trình duyệt
▪ my browser really is incredibly slow.

children.name: faq, faq x
children.definition: faq, faq/ˌef eɪ ˈkjuː, fæk/  frequently asked question(s); on websites, a list of questions that users often ask about the website, and answers to them:
examples: những câu hỏi thường gặp
▪ before e-mailing us, it might be advisable to click on faq first.
faqnoun[ c ]
abbreviation forfrequently asked question: a question in a list of questions and answers intended to help people understand a particular subject
_if you have any problems, consult the faqs on our website.

children.name: online a2
children.definition: online/ˈɒnlaɪnǁˈɔːn-/  connected to other computers through the internet, or available through the internet: go online trực tuyến
examples: ▪ i’ll just go online and look up her address.
online,on-lineadjective[ before noun ]
describes products, services or information that can be bought or used on the internet
_an online newspaper/magazine/dictionary
_online banking/shopping
onlinea2,on-lineadverbinternet
bought, used, etc. using the internet
_have you ever bought anything online?
_this dictionarywentonline in 1999.

children.name: hit b2
children.definition: hit/hɪt/  an occasion when someone uses a website, a web page, or part of a web page. companies count the number of hits their websites, advertisements, etc receive to find out how well they are doing:
examples: ▪ the official world cup web-site scored a record number of hits last week.
hitnoun[ c ]computing
a request to use aweb pageon the internet that is then counted to calculatethe number of people looking at the page
_our web page had 243 hits this week.

children.name: the net a2
children.definition: the netnoun
examples: abbreviation forthe internet
_i've found a really useful website about allergies on the net.

children.name: weblog b1
children.definition: weblognoun (alsoblog)
examples: adiary(= regular record of your thoughts, opinions and experiences) that you put on theinternet for others to read and which often containslinks(= words or pictures that connect to other places on the internet)
blogb1noun[ c ] (alsoweblog)
a diary (= regular record of your thoughts, opinions and experiences) that you put on the internet for other people to read
blogb1verb[ i ]
to write or add material to a blog
bloggerb1noun[ c ]
someone who writes a blog

children.name: things you do on the internet
surf the internet a2
children.definition: surftheinternet/net/web/ˌsɜːʳf ði ˈɪntəʳnet, ˈnet, ˈweb/  to look at information on the internet, especially when you look quickly in order to find something that interests you:
examples: lướt web, lướt mạng
▪ people caught surfing the net at work are liable to be dismissed.
surfverb[ i or t ]internet lướt(web)
to spend time visiting a lot of websites
_many towns and cities have cybercafes where you can surf the internet/net/web.

children.name: download a2
children.definition: download/ˈdaʊnləʊd/  to copy a file from the internet onto your own computer:
examples: tải về
▪ download your favorite songs by clicking here. download [countable noun]
downloadverb[ i or t ]
to copy or move programs or information into a computer's memory, especially
from the internet or a larger computer

children.name: upload b1
children.definition: upload/ˈʌpləʊd/  to copy something from your computer onto the internet: đăng tải, tải lên
examples: ▪ take great care when uploading personal information such as your address or credit card number. upload [countable noun]
uploadverb[ t ] tải lên
to copy or move programs or information to a larger computer system or to the internet

children.name: visit a2
children.definition: visit/ˈvɪzɪt, ˈvɪzət/  to use a website on the internet:
examples: ghé thăm, truy cập
▪ for more information on how you can help, visit our website.
visitverb thăm
[ t ] to go to a website on the internet

children.name: chat a2
children.definition: chat/tʃæt/  to communicate with several people by computer, using a special internet program that allows you to exchange written messages very quickly :
examples: trò chuyện (trực tuyến)
▪ you can chat to brad pitt live this evening. chat [countable noun]
chatverb[ i ]-tt- tán gẫu
to take part in a discussion with someone on the internet

children.name: instant-message/im x
children.definition: instant-message/im/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒ, ˌaɪ ˈem/  to communicate with someone by computer, using a special internet program that allows you to exchange written messages very quickly:
examples: trò chuyện, nói chuyện trực tuyến
▪ teenagers are the group most likely to im each other.
instant message/im[countable noun] instant-messaging [uncountable noun]
instant messagingnoun[ u ]
a type of service available on the internet that allows you to exchange written messages with someone else who is using the service at the same time

children.name: browse b2
children.definition: browseverbcomputing
examples: [ i or t ] to look at information on the internet
_to browse the web

children.name: google b2
children.definition: googleverbtrademark
examples: to search for something on the internet using the googlesearch engine(= computer program that finds information)

children.name: email a1
children.definition: emailalsoe-mail/ˈiːmeɪl/  electronic mail; the system that allows people to send messages and documents to each other by computer, or a message or file that has been sent using this system:
examples: thư điện tử
▪ email has revolutionized the way we all think and work.email address
▪ give me your email address and i’ll send you directions to the party.
send an email
▪ i sent him an email two weeks ago, but i haven’t heard anything back.
email,e-mailnoun
[ u ] the system for using computers to send messages over the internet
_you can contact usbyemail or fax.
_what's your emailaddress?
email,e-mailnoun
[ c ] a message or document sent using this system
_i got an email from danielle last week.

children.name: snailmail x
children.definition: snailmail/ˈsneɪlmeɪl/  the traditional system of collecting and delivering letters, packages etc - use this when you are comparing this system to email:
examples: bưu thiếp
▪ sorry about the snailmail - my email’s not working.

children.name: mailing list x
children.definition: mailing list/ˈmeɪlɪŋ ˌlɪst/  a discussion group on the internet, which consists of a list of people who can each send messages to the rest of the list by email danh sách liên hệ thư điện tử

children.name: attachment b2
children.definition: attachment/əˈtætʃmənt/  a document or file, for example a document from a word processor or spreadsheet, which is sent with an email so that it can be read and used by the person who receives the email : tệp đính kèm
examples: ▪ i’m sending the document as an attachment. please let me know if you have trouble reading it.
attachmentnouncomputing tập tinđính kèm
[ c ] a computer filewhich is sent together with an email message
_i'll email my report to youas anattachment.
_i wasn't able toopenthat attachment.

children.name: attach b1
children.definition: attach/əˈtætʃ/  to connect a document or a file to an email:
examples: đính kèm
▪ i’ve attached the latest spreadsheet for you to look at.
attachverb[ t ]computing gắn, dán
to join a file such as a document, picture or computer program, to an email

children.name: flame x
children.definition: flame/fleɪm/  to send someone a message that criticizes them on the internet, especially in a rude or angry way:
examples: nói xấu
▪ flaming your boss really isn’t a good idea, however angry you are.
flameverbcomputing
[ t ]slangto send an angry or insulting email
_please don't flame me if you disagree with this message.
flamenouncomputing
[ c ]slangan angry or offensive email
_flame wars
flamernoun[ c ]slang
someone who sends an angry or insulting email

children.name: spam c1
children.definition: spam/spæm/  email messages that a computer user has not asked for and does not want to read, for example, messages from advertisers: thư rác
examples: ▪ i was getting so much spam mail that i changed my email address.
spamming[uncountable noun]
spamnoun[ u ]computing
informal disapprovingunwanted email, usually advertisements
_i get so much spam at work.

children.name: bounce c2
children.definition: bounce/baʊns/  if an email message that you send bounces or is bounced, it is automatically returned to you because of a technical problem:
examples: bị lỗi, tự trả về
▪ she tried to mail him several times but the message always bounced.
bounceverbemail
[ i or t ] if an email that you send bounces or is bounced, it comes back to you because the address is wrong or there is a computer problem.

children.name: email a2
children.definition: emailalsoe-mail/ˈiːmeɪl/  to send someone a message or a computer file by email: gửi thư điện tử
examples: we’d been emailing each other for six months before we actually met.email somebody something
i’ll email you my résumé when i get home.
email me when you've got time.
[ + two objects ]has he emailed you that list of addresses yet?
email a photo
if you are not on facebook, just email your photos to lparizek@ounce.org

children.name: checkout b1
children.definition: checkoutnoun quầy thu tiền
examples: the place on a website where you order and pay for goods
_choose your cd-roms and proceed to checkout.

children.name: message board b1
children.definition: message boardnoun
examples: a place on a website where you can leave messages for other people to read

children.name: post b1
children.definition: postverbmessage
examples: to leave an electronic message on a website
_somebody's been posting obscene messages in this chat room.

children.name: webcam b1
children.definition: webcam,web camnoun
examples: a camera which records moving pictures and sound and allows these to be broadcast onthe internet as they happen

children.name: bookmark b2
children.definition: bookmarknouncomputing
examples: a record of the address of an internet document that is kept on your computer so that you can find it again easily
_keep this site as a bookmark.

children.name: bookmark b2
children.definition: bookmarkverb đánh dấu
examples: to make a record of the address of an internet document on your computer so that you can find it again easily
_don't forget to bookmark this page.

children.name: cookie c2
children.definition: cookienouncomputing tập tin thông tin vềngười dùng
examples: specializeda piece of information stored on your computer which contains informationabout all the internet documents that you have looked at

children.name: thread c2
children.definition: threadnounconnection
examples: [ c ] a connected group of pieces of writing on the internet, where people are talking about a particular subject
_i was so pleased to find this thread, and to know that lots of people have the same problem as me!

children.name: banner x
children.definition: bannernoun biểu ngữ; băng-rôn
examples: [ c ] (alsobanner ad/banner advertisement) an advertisement that appears across the top of aweb page

children.name: basket x
children.definition: basketnouninternet giỏhàng
examples: a place on a website where you collect things you plan to buy from the site
_there are 4 items in your basket.

children.name: domain x
children.definition: domainnouninternettên miền
examples: specializeda part of the internet that belongs to a person or organization where they can useemailor show documents on the internet

children.name: forum x
children.definition: forumnouninternet
examples: a place on the internet where people canleave messages or discuss particular subjects with other people at the same time
_discussionforums are a way of contacting people with similar interests from all over the world.

children.name: url x
children.definition: urlnoun địa chỉ của một web site
examples: abbreviationforuniform resource locator: a website address

children.name: visitor x
children.definition: visitornounkhách
examples: someone who goes to a website on the internet
